main_definition: The Nasdaq is a global electronic marketplace for buying and selling securities, primarily known as an index of over 3,000 stocks listed on the exchange.

meanings_and_examples.example: The Nasdaq is one of the largest and most well-known stock exchanges in the world.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A major global index for technology companies
meanings_and_examples.example: When people say 'tech stocks', they often refer to companies listed on the Nasdaq.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A leading platform for raising capital through initial public offerings (IPOs)
meanings_and_examples.example: Many tech startups choose to list their shares and go public via an IPO on the Nasdaq.
